examples.title: Primary
examples.description: The primary button is for the most important action on a page. Use to advance users to the next step.

examples.title: Secondary
examples.description: For non-primary or current-page actions that should be visually downplayed.

examples.title: Big
examples.description: For the only action on a page. Uses primary button styling at a larger size.

examples.title: Continue
examples.description: Specialized variation with forward arrow icon for form navigation.

when_to_use.value: **Actions**: Use buttons for clickable actions such as "Add", "Close", "Cancel", or "Save"
**Triggers**: Use buttons to trigger functionality via JavaScript, like closing a modal
**Form progression**: Primary buttons advance users to the next step in a process
**Secondary actions**: Use secondary buttons for non-primary actions that need to be downplayed

when_to_consider_else.value: **Navigation**: For links between pages, use [Link](/docs/components/link/) components instead
**Call-to-action prominence**: Consider using [Action links](/docs/components/link/action) for visually prominent CTAs linking to other pages
**General decoration**: Avoid using buttons purely for visual effect

behavior.value: Limit primary buttons per page or section to maintain their impact
Arrow icons are reserved exclusively for "Back" and "Continue" buttons in forms
Use icons in buttons only when necessary for clarityâ€”never for decoration
Avoid disabling buttons as a design solution
Primary buttons typically appear first or to the left of secondary buttons

frontMatter.code_usage:
```html
<!-- Primary button -->
<va-button text="Continue"></va-button>

<!-- Secondary button -->
<va-button text="Cancel" secondary></va-button>

<!-- Big button -->
<va-button text="Submit application" big></va-button>

<!-- Continue with arrow -->
<va-button continue></va-button>

<!-- Back with arrow -->
<va-button back></va-button>
```
frontMatter.code_usage_mobile:
```swift
// Primary button
Button("Continue", action: handleContinue)
  .buttonStyle(PrimaryButtonStyle())

// Secondary button
Button("Cancel", action: handleCancel)
  .buttonStyle(SecondaryButtonStyle())

// Destructive button
Button("Delete", role: .destructive, action: handleDelete)
  .buttonStyle(DestructiveButtonStyle())
```

```kotlin
// Primary button (Android)
VAButton(
  text = "Continue",
  onClick = { handleContinue() },
  style = VAButtonStyle.Primary
)

// Secondary button
VAButton(
  text = "Cancel",
  onClick = { handleCancel() },
  style = VAButtonStyle.Secondary
)
```
